model_answer:
The correct timeline is option B: 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5
The presenter starts by introducing the AI-in-banking module, which happens at time 1. Then, he shows a slide on the types of AI applications in banking, which occurs at time 2. After that, there is a short musical interlude, followed by the speaker citing specific examples of declining physical bank branches, which takes place at time 3. As the speaker continues his presentation, another slide appears showing the impact of digital transformation on the banking sector, including the decline in physical bank branches, which leads to a discussion about the workforce changes in the industry, such as the growth of the fintech workforce and the potential job cuts among incumbent banks, which concludes at time 5.

The correct timeline is option A: 1 -> 3 -> 2 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6.
The first event is the speaker making a remark on UK bank closings in front of a whiteboard, which happens before showing any articles or slides. This is followed by the display of an article titled "UK Bank Closings January 30, 2020," which relates to the discussion of electronic transfers and the decline of physical banks. The third event is the speaker switching to a slide titled "Downsizing Physical Branches," which discusses the downsizing of physical branches, including those of UniCredit. This is followed by the display of an article titled "AI and Size of Bank Staff," which discusses how AI will reduce the size of bank staff. The fifth event is the speaker showing an article about Goldman Sachs, which discusses the impact of AI on the banking industry and mentions the loss of Deutsche Bank. Finally, the sixth and last event is the speaker referencing a slide titled "Jobs Impact of AI in Banking," which discusses the impact of AI on jobs in the banking industry and predicts a decrease in jobs by 2030 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
